unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of households to high-speed internet. This initiative promises to bolster digital connectivity, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of households to high-speed internet. This initiative promises to bolster digital connectivity, particularly in Tier two and Tier three cities.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a senior telecom analyst, notes, "Increased FTTH penetration will significantly improve the quality of life for many, enabling seamless access to online education, healthcare, and e-commerce platforms."
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, a senior telecom analyst, notes, "Increased F T T H penetration will significantly improve the quality of life for many, enabling seamless access to online education, healthcare, and e-commerce platforms."

unnormalised: Airtel recently announced plans to extend its fiber network by 50,000 km, focusing on regions like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Jio, not to be outdone, is offering attractive bundled plans, starting from Rs. 699, to incentivize adoption.
normalised: Airtel recently announced plans to extend its fiber network by fifty thousand kilometer, focusing on regions like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Jio, not to be outdone, is offering attractive bundled plans, starting from rupee six hundred and ninety nine, to incentivize adoption.

unnormalised: The competitive landscape is driving innovation and affordability. Many apartments, averaging 1200 sq ft, are now wired for FTTH during construction, further accelerating the rollout. This initiative aligns with the Digital India campaign, aimed at creating a digitally empowered society. The industry estimates investments exceeding Rs. 50,000 crore in FTTH infrastructure over the next three years. Faster internet for all, a digital Diwali indeed!
normalised: The competitive landscape is driving innovation and affordability. Many apartments, averaging one thousand two hundred square feet, are now wired for F T T H during construction, further accelerating the rollout. This initiative aligns with the Digital India campaign, aimed at creating a digitally empowered society. The industry estimates investments exceeding rupee fifty thousand crore in F T T H infrastructure over the next three years. Faster internet for all, a digital Diwali indeed!
